description: A JSON representation of the Deno lint configurations.
title: Deno lint configuration Schema

adjacent-overload-signatures.description: Requires overload signatures to be adjacent to each other.

ban-ts-comment.description: Disallows the use of Typescript directives without a comment.

ban-types.description: Bans the use of primitive wrapper objects (e.g. String the object is a wrapper

ban-unknown-rule-code.description: Warns the usage of unknown rule codes in ignore directives

ban-untagged-ignore.description: Requires deno-lint-ignore to be annotated with one or more rule names.

ban-untagged-todo.description: Requires TODOs to be annotated with either a user tag (@user) or an issue

camelcase.description: Enforces the use of camelCase in variable names

constructor-super.description: Verifies the correct usage of constructors and calls to super().

default-param-last.description: Enforces default parameter(s) to be last in the function signature.

eqeqeq.description: Enforces the use of type-safe equality operators === and !== instead of the

explicit-function-return-type.description: Requires all functions to have explicit return types.

explicit-module-boundary-types.description: Requires all module exports to have fully typed declarations

for-direction.description: Requires for loop control variables to increment in the correct direction

getter-return.description: Requires all property getter functions to return a value

no-array-constructor.description: Enforce conventional usage of array construction

no-async-promise-executor.description: Requires that async promise executor functions are not used

no-await-in-loop.description: Requires await is not used in a for loop body

no-case-declarations.description: Requires lexical declarations (let, const, function and class) in switch

no-class-assign.description: Disallows modifying variables of class declarations

no-cond-assign.description: Disallows the use of the assignment operator, =, in conditional statements.

no-const-assign.description: Disallows modifying a variable declared as const.

no-constant-condition.description: Disallows the use of a constant expression in conditional test

no-control-regex.description: Disallows the use ascii control characters in regular expressions

no-debugger.description: Disallows the use of the debugger statement

no-deprecated-deno-api.description: Warns the usage of the deprecated Deno APIs

no-dupe-args.description: Disallows using an argument name more than once in a function signature

no-dupe-class-members.description: Disallows using a class member function name more than once

no-dupe-else-if.description: Disallows using the same condition twice in an if/else if statement

no-dupe-keys.description: Disallows duplicate keys in object literals.

no-duplicate-case.description: Disallows using the same case clause in a switch statement more than once

no-empty.description: Disallows the use of empty block statements.

no-empty-character-class.description: Disallows using the empty character class in a regular expression

no-empty-enum.description: Disallows the declaration of an empty enum

no-empty-interface.description: Disallows the declaration of an empty interface

no-empty-pattern.description: Disallows the use of empty patterns in destructuring

no-ex-assign.description: Disallows the reassignment of exception parameters

no-explicit-any.description: Disallows use of the any type

no-fallthrough.description: Disallows the implicit fallthrough of case statements

no-func-assign.description: Disallows the overwriting/reassignment of an existing function

no-global-assign.description: Disallows assignment to native Javascript objects

no-import-assign.description: Disallows reassignment of imported module bindings

no-inner-declarations.description: Disallows variable or function definitions in nested blocks

no-invalid-regexp.description: Disallows specifying invalid regular expressions in RegExp constructors

no-invalid-triple-slash-reference.description: Warns the wrong usage of triple-slash reference directives.

no-irregular-whitespace.description: Disallows the use of non-space or non-tab whitespace characters

no-misused-new.description: Disallows defining constructors for interfaces or new for classes

no-namespace.description: Disallows the use of namespace and module keywords in TypeScript code.

no-new-symbol.description: Disallows the use of new operators with built-in Symbols

no-obj-calls.description: Disallows calling built-in global objects like functions

no-octal.description: Disallows expressing octal numbers via numeric literals beginning with 0

no-prototype-builtins.description: Disallows the use of Object.prototype builtins directly

no-redeclare.description: Disallows redeclaration of variables, functions, parameters with the same name.

no-regex-spaces.description: Disallows multiple spaces in regular expression literals.

no-this-before-super.description: Disallows use of this or super before calling super() in constructors.

no-top-level-await.description: Disallows the use of top level await expressions.

no-unreachable.description: Disallows the unreachable code after the control flow statements.

no-unsafe-finally.description: Disallows the use of control flow statements within finally blocks.

no-unsafe-negation.description: Disallows the usage of negation operator ! as the left operand of relational

no-unused-vars.description: Enforces all variables used at least once.

no-var.description: Enforces the use of block scoped variables over more error prone function scoped

no-window-prefix.description: Disallows the use of Web APIs via the window object.

no-with.description: Disallows the usage of with statements.

prefer-as-const.description: Recommends using const assertion (as const) over explicitly specifying literal

prefer-ascii.description: Ensures that the code is fully written in ASCII characters.

prefer-namespace-keyword.description: Recommends the use of namespace keyword over module keyword when declaring

prefer-primordials.description: Suggests using frozen intrinsics from primordials rather than the default

require-await.description: Disallows async functions that have no await expression

require-yield.description: Disallows generator functions that have no yield.

valid-typeof.description: Restricts the use of the typeof operator to a specific set of string literals
